overview.title: What You'll Learn
overview.description: This tutorial will guide you through adding your first MCP server to Plugged.in. MCP servers extend your AI's capabilities by providing access to tools, resources, and integrations.
overview.learn1: What MCP servers are and how they work
overview.learn2: How to browse and add official MCP servers
overview.learn3: How to configure server settings and environment variables
overview.learn4: How to test your server connection and use its tools

prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
prerequisites.item2: Basic understanding of the command line (for custom servers)

step1.title: Understanding MCP Servers
step1.description: Before we add our first server, let's understand what MCP servers are and why they're powerful.

whatIs.title: What is an MCP Server?
whatIs.description: MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers are programs that provide additional capabilities to AI assistants. Think of them as plugins that extend what your AI can do.
whatIs.point1: Tools: Functions the AI can call (e.g., read files, search web, send emails)
whatIs.point2: Resources: Data the AI can access (e.g., documents, databases, APIs)
whatIs.point3: Prompts: Pre-configured instructions for specific tasks

step2.title: Navigating to MCP Servers
step2.description: Let's start by navigating to the MCP Servers section in Plugged.in.
step2.screenshot: Screenshot: Plugged.in dashboard with MCP Servers menu highlighted
step2.screenshotDesc: The MCP Servers option in the sidebar navigation
step2.tip: You can also use the keyboard shortcut Cmd/Ctrl + K and search for 'MCP Servers' to quickly navigate there.

step3.title: Adding Your First Server
step3.description: Now let's add your first MCP server. You can choose between official servers or custom ones.

official.title: Adding an Official Server
official.step2: Browse through the official server catalog
official.step4: Click 'Install' to add it to your profile
official.screenshot: Screenshot: Official server catalog with Filesystem server
official.screenshotDesc: The official server catalog showing various MCP servers

custom.title: Adding a Custom Server
custom.description: For more control, you can add a custom MCP server:
custom.step2: Enter a name for your server

step4.title: Configuring Your Server
step4.description: Each server can be configured with specific settings and environment variables.

env.title: Environment Variables
env.description: Some servers require API keys or other configuration through environment variables.
env.note: Environment variables are encrypted and stored securely in Plugged.in

step5.title: Testing Your Server
step5.description: Let's make sure your server is working correctly.

test.title: Connection Test
test.step3: Wait for the connection to establish
test.step4: Check the discovered tools and resources

step5.screenshot: Screenshot: Successful server connection with tools listed
step5.screenshotDesc: A successfully connected server showing available tools

connection.title: Server won't connect
connection.description: If your server fails to connect:
connection.solution1: Check that all required fields are filled
connection.solution2: Verify environment variables are set correctly
connection.solution3: Ensure the server command/path is correct

tools.title: No tools appearing
tools.description: This usually means the server connected but isn't configured properly. Check the server's documentation for required setup.
